page.title: 19Housing In Whitby.
page.content: Much of Whitby's old{housing}is to be found on the East Side of Whitby. Many narrow yards lead off Whitby's oldest street,{Church Street}and many dwellings have Preservation Orders. These attractive houses with their red pantile roofs have become very popular as holiday homes. Many of the original houses on the West Side of Town were built during the railway boom of the 1800's.These were mainly terraced houses.George Hudson, the 'Railway King' from York, developed the West Cliff Fields for hotels and boarding houses. { New housing estates}have brought many new families into the area.A lot of these people commute out of Whitby to work. The council provides housing for those not able to own their own property and also for the elderly.
